headline: Tesla expects to have 4.5GW of grid-forming BESS operating in Australia by the end of 2026
summary_80w: Tesla has announced that by the end of 2026, it expects to have around 4.5GW of grid-forming battery storage operating across Australia.

headline: SEIA releases policy recommendations for US solar and storage
summary_80w: The US Solar Energy Industries Association (SEIA) has released a policy blueprint which it claims would “strengthen the reliability of America’s electric grid with solar and storage technologies.”

headline: CHINA ROUND-UP: China accelerates integration of AI and new energy, Chinese company signs 600MW international PV project
summary_80w: China has advanced in the integration of AI and new energy, covering areas such as power forecasting, electricity markets, and O&M.

headline: Iberdrola signs 77MW PPA with Italian retailer Selex

headline: Nautilus, Summit Ridge secure financing for US community solar expansion

headline: US clean energy tax credit monetisation to reach up to US$60 billion in 2025 – Crux
summary_80w: The US is forecast to reach between US$55-60 billion in clean energy tax credit monetisation in 2025, according to a report from clean energy financing technology platform Crux.

headline: European PV buyer sentiment remains low, but stable, in August
summary_80w: The average price of solar modules sold in Europe fell marginally between July and August, while buyers’ confidence remained steady.

headline: Nextracker acquires Origami Solar in US$53 million deal

headline: Australia’s NEM sets new renewable energy record with solar PV providing 17GW

headline: US adds 17.9GW solar PV in first half of 2025, SEIA predicts installation slowdown
summary_80w: The US installed 17.92GW of new capacity in the first half of 2025, with quarterly declines in additions for utility-scale and residential solar.

headline: Tesla launches integrated 20MWh Megapack BESS solution

headline: US energy storage industry ‘has to continue to be aggressive’
summary_80w: “The industry has to continue to be aggressive,” says Luigi Resta, president of US renewable energy and energy storage developer rPlus Energies, on the US remaining a competitive market for energy storage.

headline: Lithium-ion is long-duration energy storage (LDES)

headline: Australia: ‘Social licensing is the next frontier for battery energy storage systems’

headline: ‘Optimising BESS performance requires long-term perspective,’ says Fluence
